DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of test tube, capillary tube, or other tube used for the collection of blood specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

Concepts.definition: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/24/22 jk Biospecimen CSI removed; CDE ownership transferred to HTAN. 10/29/19 jk released per MCL SME (Maureen/Kristen) review.  9/11/19 jk created for MCL Biospecimen tracking.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube with a formaldehyde-free preservative which stabilizes nucleated blood cells, preventing the release of genomic DNA, and allowing isolation of high-quality cell-free DNA.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube with a formaldehyde-free preservative which stabilizes nucleated blood cells, preventing the release of genomic DNA, and allowing isolation of high-quality cell-free DNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains a coagulant, designed for the collection of serum.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains a coagulant, designed for the collection of serum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains the anti-coagulant EDTA, designed for complete blood counts and blood films.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains the anti-coagulant EDTA, designed for complete blood counts and blood films.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube used for the collection of whole blood.: A solution of citric acid, sodium citrate, and dextrose used as an anticoagulant in the collection and preservation of whole blood.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube used for the collection of whole blood.
A solution of citric acid, sodium citrate, and dextrose used as an anticoagulant in the collection and preservation of whole blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

Concepts.definition: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.
A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The sodium salt of citrate with alkalinizing activity. Upon absorption, sodium citrate dissociates into sodium cations and citrate anions; organic citrate ions are metabolized to bicarbonate ions, resulting in an increase in the plasma bicarbonate concentration, the buffering of excess hydrogen ion, the raising of blood pH, and potentially the reversal of acidosis. In addition, increases in free sodium load due to sodium citrate administration may increase intravascular blood volume, facilitating the excretion of bicarbonate compounds and an anti-urolithic effect.: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

Concepts.definition: The sodium salt of citrate with alkalinizing activity. Upon absorption, sodium citrate dissociates into sodium cations and citrate anions; organic citrate ions are metabolized to bicarbonate ions, resulting in an increase in the plasma bicarbonate concentration, the buffering of excess hydrogen ion, the raising of blood pH, and potentially the reversal of acidosis. In addition, increases in free sodium load due to sodium citrate administration may increase intravascular blood volume, facilitating the excretion of bicarbonate compounds and an anti-urolithic effect.
A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
